name: Straight Bar Cable Front Raise
how_to_perform:
1. Stand facing a cable machine with the bar set to the lowest position, held by your arms and your hands shoulder-width apart.

2. Step into the platform of the machine, allowing it to support your body heightwise, while keeping your back straight and chest up.

3. Focus on lifting the load forward using only your front deltoids and arms.

4. As you lift the bar, bend your knees slightly to protect your lower back.

5. Raise the bar to a comfortable height until your hands almost touch your shoulders.

6. Pause briefly at the top of the movement before lowering it slowly in control.

7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: The straight bar cable front raise is an upper body exercise that targets the front deltoids and triceps, typically performed using a cable machine.
equipment_used: Cable machine with straight bar attachment
